job_title: Training and Awareness Analyst of Cyber Security
listing_jobDesc:
Training and Awareness Analyst of Cyber Security – Denver, Co
Are you a data expert with a focus on enhancing security? Can you solve complex problems creatively while adhering to the most advanced industry standards? Join Western Union as a Training and Awareness Analyst of Cyber Security.
Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful
We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 10,000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.
Better requires process, discipline, and simplification
1+ years of experience assisting with projects, communications, or training efforts.
Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing (to include technical documentation).
Strong growth mindset with the willingness to learn new skills and tools.
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and research skills.
Capable of multi-tasking, prioritizing, and managing time efficiently.
Must have the ability to communicate complex information, concepts, or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal, written, and/or visual means.
Ability to function in a collaborative environment, seeking continuous consultation with other team members and employees.
Experience developing and disseminating technical and non-technical information /guidance in the computer technology field.
Cyber Security experience preferred, but not required.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred.
Join us, and let’s move money for better
Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.
We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.
Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and success. Western Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy or related medical conditions), national origin, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected category.
Annual base salary gross: $63,106 - $100,969. The base salary range represents the anticipated low and high end of the Western Union salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and proficiency for the role. The base salary is one component of Western Union’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include short term incentives, health insurance (several options to choose from), accident and life insurance, access to the best in class learning and development platforms, to name just a few! To view more details of our benefits, visit us here: https://mywubenefits.com. In addition to the annual salary, this role is also eligible to receive an annual bonus. This position is part of the International Developmental Finance Corporation (DFC), Office of Information Technology (OIT).The incumbent serves as the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and develops, implements, and maintains the Information Security Program to accomplish information assurance objectives through formal policies, awareness training, monitoring compliance and security controls.The CISO is responsible for:Providing subject matter expertise and acting as senior advisor to the OIT Chief Information Officer (CIO) on all matters pertaining to information assurance. Performs information security as primary duty.Ensuring agency compliance with all federal laws and mandates regarding information security and information assuranceProviding training and oversight to personnel with significant responsibilities for information security that is commensurate with their responsibilities.Periodically assessing risk and magnitude of the harm resulting from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of information and information systems that support the operations and assets of the agency.Reviewing all proposed changed to DFC information systems architectures to ensure that the changes consider and are modified to reflect the requirement to protect both information systems and information participates as required on the Enterprise Change Management - Change Advisory Board Promotes, develops, operates, and ensures successful IT Contingency Planning activities.Ensuring the preparation and maintenance of plans and procedures to provide continuity of operations for information systems that support the operations and assets of the agency.Maintaining a current working knowledge of information assurance best practices and innovative solutions within both government and industry.Developing, recommending, influencing, and evaluating technology support, infrastructure operation, custom applications, and governing policies.Identifying potential threats to the system or system components, and notifying the appropriate personnel/mangers of the risk potential.Developing and maintaining risk-based, cost-effective information security policies, procedures, and control techniques to address all applicable requirements throughout the life cycle of each information system to ensure compliance with applicable requirements and to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all DFC information system. Periodically tests and evaluates the effectiveness of information security policies, procedures, practices and controls.Requirements: Conditions of EmploymentMust be a U.S. Citizen or NationalMales born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective ServiceMust submit resume and supporting documents (See How To Apply)Suitability for Federal employment, as determined by a background investigationMay be required to successfully complete a probationary periodMust be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearancePosition is subject to random drug testingQualificationsApplicants must meet all eligibility and qualification requirements no later than 30 days after the closing date of this announcement.Applicants for this position must meet the GS-2210 requirement AND the specialized experience requirement.GS-2210 Requirement:  Individuals must have IT-related experience demonstrating each of the four competencies listed below. Experience must be IT related; the experience may be demonstrated by paid or unpaid experience and/or completion of specific, intensive training (for example, IT certification), as appropriate.Attention to Detail - Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.Customer Service - Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services.Oral Communication - Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately.Problem Solving - Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information;
